questionText.text: Which of the following are the volatile memories?
Which of the following memories are programmed during production.
Which of the following are generally carried by bus (In Computer Hardware)
What is the capacity of a disk with two platters, 10,000 cylinders, an average of 400 sectors per track, and 512 bytes per sector? (answer in Gigabytes.)
Tracks are divided into _______

options.option: The bus that carries control signals

questionText.text: Which one of the following is called as control bus.

options.option: Time to position heads over cylinder containing target sector.
Time waiting for first bit of target sector to pass under r/w head.
Time to read the bits in the target sector.
Average time to access some target sector.

questionText.text: Seek time is ________
SSD stands for ________
Which one of the following has the highest performance in accessing (r/w) data.

options.option: Recently referenced items are likely to be referenced again in the near future.
Items with nearby addresses tend to be referenced close together in time
Items with far addresses tend to be referenced close together in time
Recently referenced items are not likely to be referenced again in the near future.

questionText.text: Temporal Locality is ____________
Which  one of the following acts as a staging area for a subset of the data in a larger slower device.

options.option: The data that is required is in the cache memory

questionText.text: Cold misses occurs because of

options.option: This will occur when there is a cache miss.
When all the data objects are pointing to different levels blocks
When multiple data objects are pointing to the same level k block.

questionText.text: Conflict misses are __________ (Check all that apply)

activity_name: Video on The Cache Memories - Part 1 (Direct Mapped Caches)

options.option: Registers, L1 Cache, L2 Cache, L3 Cache, RAM, Secondary storage, Cloud Storage.
Registers, L1 Cache, L2 Cache, L3 Cache, Cloud Storage, RAM, Secondary storage
Registers, L1 Cache, L2 Cache, L3 Cache, RAM, Cloud Storage, Secondary storage

questionText.text: Which of the following follows the memory hierarchy?

options.option: When a program needs a particular object and found cache memory
When a program needs a particular object and doesn’t found cache memory
When a program needs a particular object and found in main memory (DRAM)
When a program needs a particular object and doesn’t found in one of the registers in the CPU.

questionText.text: Cache hit ________

options.option: When a program needs a particular object and found cache memory
When a program needs a particular object and doesn’t found in the cache memory
When a program needs a particular object and found in main memory (DRAM)
When a program needs a particular object and doesn’t found in the registers in the CPU.

questionText.text: Cache Miss _________

options.option: If there is a cache miss and the data will be loaded from the lower memory (in hierarchy).
If there is a cache miss and the data will be loaded from the lower memory (in hierarchy) and possibly replaces one of the block.

questionText.text: Cache Eviction is _______
Generally the cache memory will reside in __________
Which of the following are the valid cache mappings. (Check all that apply)

options.option: C = S * E * B data bytes

questionText.text: Generally the cache size will be defined by ________
For each cache, determine the number of cache sets (S), tag bits (t), set index bits (s), and block offset bits (b). Where m = 32, C = 1024, B = 4 and E = 1
For each cache, determine the number of cache sets (S), tag bits (t), set index bits (s), and block offset bits (b). Where m = 32, C = 1024, B = 8 and E = 4
How many lines (e)  per set (s) will be there in a direct mapped cache?

activity_name: Video on The Cache Memories - Part 2 (E way Set Associative Cache)

options.option: Set selection is identical to a direct-mapped cache, with the set index bits identifying the set.
Set selection is identical to a direct-mapped cache, with the valid bits identifying the set.
Set selection is identical to a direct-mapped cache, with the block bits identifying the set.
Set selection is identical to a direct-mapped cache, with the tag bits identifying the set.

questionText.text: How the set selection will be made in set associative cache.

options.option: it must check the tags and block bits of multiple lines in order to determine if the requested word is in the set
it must check the tags and set bits of multiple lines in order to determine if the requested word is in the set
it must check the tags and valid bits of first lines in order to determine if the requested word is in the set
it must check the tags and valid bits of multiple lines in order to determine if the requested word is in the set

questionText.text: How the line matching and word selection will happen in set associative cache ?

options.option: None of the cases described above

activity_json.text:
Download the cache-lab handout from hereand start doing the lab. If you have any questions please don’t hesitate in asking your mentors for clarifications.
  1. Extract the cachelab-handout.zip and check for the cachelab.pdf. Go through the instructions given in handout pdf and then start doing the lab.
  2. Define the data structure to handle the cache memory
  3. Look at the test cases.
  4. Make a plan (todo list) how you are going to implement the cache lab.
